title: Davidvictorson
author: Davidvictorson
content: It's a good day for bitcoin today. Each bitcoin win should be celebrated because it was a victory against naysayers, haters, and those who wants bitcoin to die. Today, Guinness World Records have added Bitcoin and other blockchain events in its latest record book under a brand-new category called ‚ÄúCryptomania". Bitcoin was included in the 2023 edition as the most valuable crypto with a market capitalization of $816.69 billion as well as being recognised for being the world‚Äôs first decentralised cryptocurrency after it launched in early 2009. CoinMarketCap reports that, Bitcoin‚Äôs market cap stood at $372,316,153,554. In addition, El Salvador also features in the book as the ‚Äúfirst country to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender‚Äù last year.¬† Nothing can stop bitcoin nowSource

comments.author: Vaskiy
comments.body: Bitcoin into the Guinness World Records adds value. Having a separate category can add more technology based innovation to the category. In the future we can see Guinness World Records being added to the blockchain, so that no data manipulation takes place.The best part is El Salvador getting into the Guinness World Records book as the first nation to adopt bitcoin as legal tender.

comments.author: nullama
comments.body: Quote from: https://cryptodaily.co.uk/2022/10/bitcoin-debuts-in-guinness-world-recordsIt was hoped that this move, which was condemned by the World Bank, would reduce the cost of international transfers ‚Äî an important consideration for a country that is reliant on money sent home by workers overseas.I think this is going to be one of the most important aspects when thinking about countries adopting Bitcoin as legal tender.Poorer countries spend lots of money in fees paid to overseas companies just to let them move their money.With Bitcoin they can transfer money worldwide with minimum fees. This is truly a game changer.The problem is, of course, those companies don't want Bitcoin to be adopted in those countries. So they'll do anything they can to stop it.They can't stop Bitcoin itself, so they try to convince people that Bitcoin is bad.It's great to see El Salvador to make this huge step forward.Others already started following, like the Central African Republic.

It deserves even more accolades.Well, that's just the beginning of the trail- line.Sandra üíá

comments.author: kawetsriyanto
comments.body: We must be proud that Bitcoin is recognized as "the first decentralized crypto" by Guinness world records.It proves that people already think that Bitcoin is already something important in our life, haters have no chance to claim Bitcoin will be over soon. I just can't wait for another record to achieve by Bitcoin once it becomes the first crypto to be legally accepted as a means of payment in all countries in the world. ¬†Regarding El Salvador, they deserve to call "the first country to become a pioneer for crypto massive adoption in the future".

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: Wow...this is a big good news for Bitcoin and the people/community who continue supporting the King of all cryptos. Getting into Guinness adds more credibility and recognition to the original cryptocurrency which many people think should have no place in our society...but contrary to their wish Bitcoin is getting more and more accolades as time goes on. I am sure that 2023 will be another banner year for Bitcoin in terms of getting more into the mainstream, recognition and acceptance especially from those who thought that this is just another joke...and hopefully next year it will also be rising in value reaching a new ATH if possible.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: The marketcap figure is not correct if we know there are many bitcoins have been lost since 2009 and very most likely those bitcoins won't be recovered.We can not know the exact number of lost bitcoins so that we can not calculate the absolute marketcap of total bitcoins left in circulating supply. Anyway it is still good to have a rough number for Bitcoin marketcap as it somewhat shows how big or small Bitcoin is in cryptocurrency market as well as in a comparison with other markets.I don't mind about records, Guinness World Record for Bitcoin or cryptocurrency but in reality it is not harmful but helpful to spread Bitcoin news to more people. And it is a part of Bitcoin adoption journey that is long and has lot of things to achieve.

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: this is a testament to the countries that oppose and even hate Bitcoin and crypto.now countries will be more open with their government policies regarding bitcoin and crypto.El Salvador answers the doubts and sentiments of some countries towards Bitcoin as a legal tender.I also thought, can the bitcoin pizza celebration fall into the "Cryptomania" category?

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: I wouldn't have guessed that bitcoin would make it into the Guinness Book of World Records, but the market cap makes sense.Quote from: tbct_mt2 on October 19, 2022, 01:43:59 AMThe marketcap figure is not correct if we know there are many bitcoins have been lost since 2009 and very most likely those bitcoins won't be recovered.We can not know the exact number of lost bitcoins so that we can not calculate the absolute marketcap of total bitcoins left in circulating supply. In any case, the market cap is an indicative figure because, for example, at today's price, all the bitcoins could be sold for around 20,000 USD, but if a whale puts a large quantity of bitcoins on sale, the price would fall, so the market cap would be lower. Quote from: tbct_mt2 on October 19, 2022, 01:43:59 AMAnyway it is still good to have a rough number for Bitcoin marketcap as it somewhat shows how big or small Bitcoin is in cryptocurrency market as well as in a comparison with other markets.I agree.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Of course, this is some kind of good news. But aside from the recognition, I don't think this amounts to so much. After all, Guinness World Records is just a book of records. It lists both good and bad, everything in a neutral way, including even the longest fart. It doesn't vouch for Bitcoin or any other. It doesn't say Bitcoin is good. It doesn't say Bitcoin has huge potential or has a bright future. Bitcoin is there, of course, not because of anything else but simply because it is the first and then it has the largest market cap. Aside from Bitcoin, NFTs and fan tokens also made it to the latest book release.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: This recent record hasn‚Äôt made it to the records listed on the Guiness World Records site yet, but searching for all records that mention bitcoin, I‚Äôve come across the following:Largest bitcoin fraud (*)First commercial Bitcoin transaction (*)First Bitcoin Transaction First Minecraft server with a bitcoin economyFirst country to adopt bitcoin as legal tenderMost valuable cryptocurrencyOldest CryptocurrencyFirst cryptocurrency Exchange (*)First blockchainLargest cryptocurrency hackFirst decentralized cryptocurrencyFirst seizure of cryptocurrencyFirst NFTLargest cryptocurrency winning jackpot in an online poker tournamentMost expensive NTF artwork (limited edition)Largest seizure of cryptocurrencyMost valuable sports club NTFThough bitcoin is mentioned somewhere in the descriptive text of each record, a few of them are not really bitcoin related (I‚Äôve left them there so we van see the reference to bitcoin regardless).Some of those records seem a bit far-fetched (too thinly categorized), and I‚Äôd place a few as curiosities rather than meaningful records, but what the hell ‚Ä¶ (*) These make a reference to Bitcointalk in their associated text description.
